text: Is there a way of knowing if a visit is new to be able to run a function?

Hello! Is there any Hubl option to stop the tracking script of HubSpot CTAs like the “no_wrapper” parameter to for the wrapper div? I want to make a speed page test of webpage content without loading these scripts.
If you don't require tracking, would it not be best to use a normal coded button?
Tested it a bit more and still getting the same result
<@UD53A9UUR> <@U2H3TT8F2> Any thoughts on why this would be happening?
Should I just use a "single line of text" to get around this? I'd prefer not to as that would get pretty ugly pretty quickly
Hey Dana, whats the intended outcome of the design? Would you be able to create a custom module with this in there? I’ll pass this feedback internally to some folks.
Is there an easy way to exclude a blog tag from a dropdown list using  `{% for tag in content.tag_list %}` if I have a "category-name" that I don't want to show in the list?

Hey! So the intention was to be able to us dynamically insert an SVG within an item that could be reused across the pages and easily editable by a designer or someone who doesn't have immediate access to the backend. We can't nest custom modules or I would consider breaking it out into its own, but it still doesn't quite get around the need for having it be dynamically controlled.
and I left this hanging in draft mode for 4 hours :joy:
